From kubectl describe service mongodb-rate: the Service is ClusterIP with Port and TargetPort both set to 27017 and an active endpoint (10.244.1.22:27017), so the Service side is configured as expected. Together these indicate the service is reachable at the expected address/port but the rate pod lacks provided connection config/credentials, which is the likely root cause of startup failures.

final_report.root_cause: The hotel-reserv-rate container (rate) is failing on startup because the pod spec does not provide required backend connection configuration (missing environment variables / mounted config/secret for MongoDB and memcached). The application attempts to initialize its DB/cache connections on startup, encounters missing configuration, exits with code 1, and enters CrashLoopBackOff. The memcached-rate and mongodb-rate Services and endpoints are healthy, so the failure is due to the rate pod's misconfiguration, not backend availability.
affected_resources: rate service/process (rate container instances in this deployment) — unavailable due to crashloop
application functionality that depends on the rate service (hotel reservation rating/recommender flows) — impaired
final_report.evidence_summary: 1) Pod describe: rate-c9bc58c85-2pgpp shows container hotel-reserv-rate Last State Terminated (Reason: Error) Exit Code 1, Restart Count 6, current state Waiting (CrashLoopBackOff). 2) Container logs (last lines) show only "Initializing DB connection..." immediately before termination and no stacktrace or OOM/kill/probe failure. 3) Pod spec contains only JAEGER_SAMPLE_RATIO env var and no MongoDB or memcached host/port/credentials env vars or mounted secrets/configs. 4) memcached-rate and mongodb-rate Services are correctly configured and have endpoints (memcached-rate -> 10.244.1.30:11211; mongodb-rate -> 10.244.1.22:27017), so backends are reachable. Correlation: app dies during its DB init step and the pod lacks connection configuration — indicates missing/misconfigured env/config for backends is the proximate cause.
final_report.investigation_summary: Priority #1 (completed): Confirmed crash loop behavior and application-level exit (Exit Code 1) on startup; logs show termination right after "Initializing DB connection..." — rules out OOM and probe failures. Priority #2 (completed): Inspected pod spec and memcached-rate Service — memcached Service and endpoints are present but the rate pod has no memcached host/port env var or args. Priority #3 (completed): Inspected mongodb-rate Service and pod spec — mongodb Service and endpoint present but the rate pod lacks MongoDB URL/credentials/env or mounted secret. Across priorities the evidence consistently indicates the rate pod is missing required configuration for its dependencies, causing startup failure. No additional evidence was required to localize the cause to the rate pod configuration.
